Pushpa 2 stampede row: What questions did the Hyderabad police ask Allu Arjun? 'How many bouncers...' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Pushpa 2 stampede: After a questioning of nearly two-and-a-half hours, Allu Arjun was let off by the Chikkadpally police.

Date: Dec 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Telugu actor Allu Arjun was questioned by the Hyderabad police regarding the stampede that led to the death of a woman during the screening of his movie, Pushpa 2. He was let off after nearly two-and-a-half hours of questioning.

  • Allu Arjun appeared before the police following an incident on December 4 that was linked to his unscheduled appearance at a theater.
  • The police inquired if he knew about the denial of permission from authorities for his appearance.
  • Questions focused on who arranged the security and bouncers for the event.
  • There were accusations regarding the actor's actions during the event contributing to the crowd surge.
“The police had denied permission for the event.” - Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy

In conclusion, the questioning of Allu Arjun by the police raises serious concerns about the accountability of public figures during large events, especially concerning safety and crowd management.
newTitle: Hyderabad Police Question Allu Arjun Over Pushpa 2 Stampede Incident

Congress files plea in Supreme Court against amendments to election rules - The Hindu
summary:
Congress Challenges Changes to Election Rules in Supreme Court

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

The Congress party has filed a plea in the Supreme Court against recent amendments to the Conduct of Election Rules, claiming they infringe on citizens’ access to election-related records.

  • Amendments to Rule 93 of the Conduct of Election Rules of 1961 limit public access to CCTV footage and video recordings from polling stations.
  • The amendment was implemented on December 20, 2024, by the Ministry of Law and Justice.
  • Citing the need to protect the electoral process, officials argued these changes were essential to prevent misinformation.
  • Jairam Ramesh emphasized the importance of public consultation and transparency in elections.
“The integrity of the electoral process is fast eroding. Hopefully the Supreme Court will help restore it,” said Jairam Ramesh.

The Congress aims to uphold transparency in the electoral process through this legal challenge.
newTitle: Congress Challenges Changes to Election Rules in Supreme Court

"Family Will Die By Suicide If...": Atul Subhash's Father On Grandson's Custody - NDTV
summary:
Family Will Die By Suicide If...: Atul Subhash's Father On Grandson's Custody

Published on: Patna

The father of Atul Subhash, who tragically died by suicide, is seeking custody of his 2-year-old grandson amidst concerns for the child's safety. Subhash's family fears that without intervention, they may suffer severe consequences.

  • Atul Subhash died by suicide after allegations of harassment from his wife and in-laws.
  • His father, Pawan Modi, filed an FIR seeking custody of his grandson, fearing harm to the child.
  • The case is being handled by Jaunpur police due to jurisdictional issues.
  • The Supreme Court is involved, requesting reports regarding the child's recovery.
  • A death note left by Subhash highlighted his anguish and concerns for his child's future.
  • Family members are advocating for legal reforms to prevent misuse of laws like dowry harassment.
"My whole family will die by suicide if we do not get our grandson back," said Pawan Modi.

The situation escalates as the family seeks justice and ensuring the safety of the young child amidst legal battles.

title: Jaipur LPG accident: How did tanker driver survive fire that killed 13? - Hindustan Times
summary:
Jaipur LPG accident: How did tanker driver survive fire that killed 13?

Date: Dec 24, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The LPG tanker explosion on the Jaipur-Ajmer highway resulted in a tragic incident, killing 13 individuals. Thankfully, the driver managed to escape unharmed.

  • The explosion occurred after the tanker collided with a truck, leading to an extensive fire.
  • The driver, Jaiveer, recognized the danger when he noticed the damage to the tanker's nozzle.
  • Over 30 vehicles were engulfed in flames, and many individuals suffered severe burns.
  • Police have initiated an investigation into the incident, looking into potential negligence.
"We cannot blame the tanker driver immediately as the container truck driver had hit his vehicle," said Deputy Commissioner of Police (West) Amit Kumar.

This incident raises significant concerns about road safety and the transportation of hazardous materials.
newTitle: Survivor of Jaipur LPG Tanker Explosion: What Happened?

title: Jaipur accident: How did LPG tanker driver survive fire that killed 13? - Hindustan Times
summary:
Jaipur accident: How did LPG tanker driver survive fire that killed 13?

Publication Date: Dec 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

An LPG tanker collided with a truck on the Jaipur-Ajmer highway, resulting in an explosion that killed 13 people and injured many others. The driver, Jaiveer, managed to escape the disaster with no severe injuries.

  • Jaiveer, the tanker's driver, escaped before the fire ignited.
  • The accident led to a massive fire engulfing over 30 vehicles.
  • The explosion killed 13 individuals and injured around 41 others.
  • Authorities are investigating the incident under multiple legal charges.
“We cannot blame the tanker driver immediately as the container truck driver had hit his vehicle...” - Deputy Commissioner of Police (West) Amit Kumar

The investigation continues as police search for answers regarding this tragic incident and steps are taken to prevent future occurrences.

BJP’s outreach to Christian community in Kerala faces backlash - The Hindu
summary:
BJP's Outreach to Christian Community in Kerala Faces Backlash

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The BJP's outreach efforts to the Christian community in Kerala are generating significant socio-political backlash, particularly following a controversial incident during Christmas celebrations.

  • The BJP has been actively engaging with Kerala's Christian community but faces opposition due to recent events.
  • A sarcastic post by a bishop highlighted the contradictions in BJP's outreach amidst incidents of vandalism against Christmas decorations.
  • The CPI(M) and Congress criticized the BJP following a disruption of Christmas festivities at a government school.
  • Protests against the BJP's tactics have been organized by youth groups, promoting a festive spirit that contrasts with the political tensions.
  • BJP leaders are attempting to distance the party from negative incidents, denouncing anti-Christian remarks made by their own party members.
  • VHP representatives have defended their actions, stating that their grievances against the school activities were based on juvenile justice considerations.
Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan stated that the BJP's overtures were reminiscent of a "wolf in sheep’s clothing," signaling the party's anti-minority stance.

The ongoing situation represents a complex interplay of political strategy and community relations, with potential long-term consequences for the BJP's engagements in Kerala.
newTitle: BJP's Efforts to Connect with Kerala's Christian Community Meet Resistance

title: AAP's Police Case Over Arvind Kejriwal's 'Drunk Constitution Writers' Video - NDTV
summary:
AAP Files Police Case Over Kejriwal's Controversial Comments on Constitution

Date: Not provided Source: Not provided

An investigation has been initiated against social media users who shared a video of Arvind Kejriwal, the Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) national convenor, allegedly implying that the Constitution was written by someone under the influence of alcohol.

  • A police case has been registered targeting individuals including Vibhor Anand, a Delhi lawyer.
  • Multiple FIRs were filed for tarnishing the image of Mr. Kejriwal, particularly affecting sentiments within Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes.
  • The remarks by Mr. Kejriwal were taken from a speech, where he referenced the Congress party's version of the Constitution.
  • The case cites various sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and the SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act.
  • This controversy coincides with ongoing discussions related to BR Ambedkar during a recent parliamentary session.
“It has become a fashion to say Ambedkar, Ambedkar, Ambedkar... If they took God's name so many times, they would have got a place in heaven.” - Amit Shah

The incident highlights the intertwining of political discourse and social media, igniting debates on accountability and freedom of expression.
newTitle: AAP Files Police Case Over Kejriwal's Controversial Comments on Constitution

title: Illegal immigration racket busted in Delhi, 5 Bangladeshi nationals arrested - India Today
summary:
Delhi Police Busts Illegal Immigration Racket; 11 Arrested

Published On: Dec 24, 2024

Published By: Manisha Pandey

Delhi Police has uncovered an illegal immigration racket involving Bangladeshi nationals, leading to the arrest of 11 individuals in connection with the syndicate that manufactured fake documents.

  • Five Bangladeshi nationals were arrested in the operation.
  • Arrests included those accused of forging fake documents, including Aadhaar cards, PAN cards, and voter IDs.
  • The investigation followed the murder of Seton Sheikh, who was aiding illegal immigrants.
  • The organized network allegedly operates a website for document forgery.
  • The police are exploring potential electoral fraud related to the forged voter cards.
“The murder was motivated by financial disputes and personal grudges.”

The crackdown signifies significant efforts by Delhi Police to address illegal immigration and document forgery, with ongoing investigations for broader criminal connections.
newTitle: Delhi Police Busts Illegal Immigration Racket; 11 Arrested

title: Snowy splendor: From Kashmir to Shimla, it is a white Christmas in Himalayas - The Times of India
summary:
Snowy splendor: From Kashmir to Shimla, it is a white Christmas in Himalayas

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Times of India

The enchanting landscapes of Shimla and Kashmir have taken on a magical winter charm, with snowfall bringing joy to locals and tourists alike. This winter season sees heavy snow, promising both beautiful vistas and economic benefits for the region.

  • Shimla transformed into a winter haven, attracting numerous visitors excited to witness the falling snow.
  • Snowfall enhances Shimla's reputation as a premier winter tourism destination.
  • The effects of snowfall are economically significant, boosting hopes for a rich apple harvest among farmers.
  • Kashmir experiences the harshest winter days, with extremely low temperatures and significant snowfall.
  • The ongoing winter conditions are expected to increase tourist traffic during the Christmas season, boosting local businesses.
“Snowfall, often referred to as 'white manure' for apple orchards, has renewed hopes for a bountiful harvest among farmers.”

In conclusion, the winter snowfall brings both beauty and opportunities for the residents and businesses in the Himalayan region, making this season particularly special.
newTitle: Snowy splendor: From Kashmir to Shimla, it is a white Christmas in Himalayas

title: Day after Modi meeting with Catholic Bishops, a swipe from Kerala: ‘There they honour, here they destroy’ - The Indian Express
summary:
Day after Modi meeting with Catholic Bishops, a swipe from Kerala: ‘There they honour, here they destroy’

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Indian Express

A day after Prime Minister Narendra Modi attended Christmas celebrations hosted by the Catholic Bishops Conference of India (CBCI) in Delhi, a senior Orthodox Church Bishop in Kerala criticized the event on social media, linking it to local incidents of disruption at Christmas celebrations in schools.

  • The Bishop of Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church, Yuhanon Meletius, made a statement on Facebook comparing the honor given to bishops in Delhi to the destruction of Christmas cribs in Kerala.
  • Recent disruptions at Christmas celebrations in Palakkad involve VHP leaders questioning the Christmas observances at a local government school.
  • A crib erected at a government school was reported vandalized, and police are investigating the incidents.
  • BJP leaders have been engaging with bishops in Kerala as part of a 'sneha yatra' to build community ties during Christmas.
  • BJP state president K Surendran claims the disruptions are part of a larger conspiracy to damage relations with the Christian community.
“There, they honour the bishops and revere the crib. Here, they destroy the cribs.”

The recent events have raised questions about the state of communal relations and the influence of political agendas during festive celebrations.
newTitle: Modi's Christmas Meeting Sparks Controversy in Kerala

title: Delhi High Court refuses to stay order calling for revised CLAT 2025 results - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Delhi High Court refuses to stay order calling for revised CLAT 2025 results

Published on: 24 Dec 2024, 7:07 am

The Delhi High Court has declined to stay an order that mandates the revision of results for the Common Law Admission Test 2025 (CLAT-UG) due to errors found in two questions.

  • The Court upheld a previous ruling by a single judge requiring the NLU Consortium to revise the results.
  • Acting Chief Justice Vibhu Bakhru criticized the NLU Consortium's failure to correct apparent errors made by their expert committees.
  • The NLU Consortium and the CLAT candidate have both filed appeals following the single-judge ruling.
The Delhi High Court is hearing appeals by a CLAT aspirant and NLU Consortium on the single judge decision regarding CLAT UG 2025 question paper.

This case underlines the importance of accuracy in standardized testing and accountability of governing bodies.
newTitle: Delhi High Court Rules on CLAT 2025 Results Revision

title: Smuggler Sunil Yadav shot dead in US, Lawrence Bishnoi aide claims responsibility: ‘…have avenged him’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Smuggler Sunil Yadav shot dead in US, Lawrence Bishnoi aide claims responsibility: ‘…have avenged him’

Date: Dec 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Drugs smuggler Sunil Yadav was killed in a shootout in Stockton, California. He was a notorious smuggler wanted for multiple drug-related crimes in India.

  • Sunil Yadav was known to smuggle drugs into India via Pakistan.
  • He had fled to the US two years ago using a fake passport.
  • Rohit Godara claimed the killing was an act of revenge for Yadav's involvement in the death of gangster Ankit Bhadu.
  • California police and Indian authorities are investigating the circumstances surrounding Yadav's death.
"He had worked with Punjab police to get our brother Ankit Bhadu killed in an encounter. We have avenged him," said Rohit Godara.

The killing marks a significant escalation in the ongoing gang conflicts that span multiple countries.
newTitle: Smuggler Sunil Yadav shot dead in US: Aide claims revenge

title: UP minor stripped naked, urinated on in birthday party; dies by suicide - Hindustan Times
summary:
Tragic Suicide of Minor in Uttar Pradesh After Harassment at Birthday Party

Publication Date: Dec 24, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

A minor boy from Uttar Pradesh Basti died by suicide after facing severe harassment at a birthday party. His family claims that he was stripped, beaten, and urinated on, leading to his tragic decision.

  • The incident occurred on December 20, during a birthday party in the victim's village.
  • The boy was allegedly assaulted and humiliated in front of other attendees.
  • The victim’s family reported that their attempt to file a police complaint was ignored.
  • The family learned of the incident the next day when the boy recounted his experience.
  • Despite efforts to get police assistance, no action was taken for three days.
“He was invited to a birthday party... he was stripped naked and beaten and even urinated on.” - Uncle of the victim

This tragic incident highlights the urgent need for better protective measures for minors and accountability among law enforcement authorities.
newTitle: Tragic Suicide of Minor in Uttar Pradesh After Harassment at Birthday Party

title: Allu Arjun At Hyderabad Police Station For Questioning In 'Pushpa 2' Stampede Case - NDTV
summary:
Allu Arjun Questioned by Hyderabad Police in 'Pushpa 2' Stampede Case

Date: 24 December 2024

Source: NDTV

Actor Allu Arjun is being questioned by Hyderabad Police over a deadly stampede during the screening of his film 'Pushpa 2', which resulted in the death of a young mother and critical injury to her son.

Key Points

  • Allu Arjun arrived at Chikkadpally Police Station for questioning following his interim bail in the case.
  • He was arrested last week amid controversy regarding police procedures during his arrest.
  • The High Court granted him bail, emphasizing his right to liberty amid criticism of police actions.
  • There are disputes between the actor's camp and police about the circumstances surrounding the stampede.
  • CCTV footage suggests Mr. Arjun received police escort, countering claims he ignored warnings.
  • Both the actor and theatre management have been charged with culpable homicide not amounting to murder.
  • The incident led to protests outside Arjun's residence, with divided public sentiment regarding his involvement.
  • The victim's husband has expressed support for the actor, indicating a willingness to withdraw the case against him.

Notable Quotes

“It was not a roadshow or procession. I just waved to people and went inside theatre.” - Allu Arjun
“I do not blame the actor for the stampede.” - Victim's Husband

The situation surrounding the stampede is complex, with ongoing inquiries and community reactions echoing the tragedy's impact on both the victims' family and the actor's public image.
newTitle: Allu Arjun Questioned by Hyderabad Police in 'Pushpa 2' Stampede Case

summary:
Allu Arjun Faces Police Inquiry Over Pushpa-2 Stampede Incident

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Actor Allu Arjun appeared at the Chikkadpally Police Station in Hyderabad for questioning concerning a tragic stampede during the Pushpa-2 screening that resulted in the death of a woman and injuries to her son.

  • Allu Arjun visited the police station following a notice served to him to appear for questioning.
  • The incident occurred on December 4, resulting in a fatality and critical injuries.
  • Police had anticipated large crowds and made security arrangements accordingly.
  • He was previously arrested and spent a night in jail before being released on bail.
“The case is under investigation and your presence is quite essential before the undersigned officer...” - B. Raju Naik, inspector of Chikkadpally Police Station.

This inquiry highlights the ongoing investigation into the Pushpa-2 stampede, emphasizing the need for accountability regarding crowd control at public events.
